jcr:content.jcr:title: Grammy Award for Best Original Jazz Composition

contentheadline.headline: Grammy Award for Best Original Jazz Composition

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} The [[Grammy Award]] for '''Best Original Jazz Composition''' was awarded from 1961 to 1967. In 1961 the award was called the Grammy Award for '''Best Jazz Composition of More Than Five Minutes Duration'''. The award was presented to the composer of the music. Years reflect the year in which the Grammy Awards were presented, for works released in the previous year. ==1960s== *[[Grammy Awards of 1967]] **[[Duke Ellington]] for "In the Beginning God" *[[Grammy Awards of 1966]] **[[Lalo Schifrin]] for ''Jazz Suite on the Mass Texts'' performed by [[Paul Horn (musician)|Paul Horn]] *[[Grammy Awards of 1965]] **[[Lalo Schifrin]] for "The Cat" *[[Grammy Awards of 1964]] **[[Steve Allen]] & [[Ray Brown (musician)|Ray Brown]] for "Gravy Waltz" performed by Steve Allen *[[Grammy Awards of 1963]] **[[Vince Guaraldi]] for "[[Cast Your Fate to the Wind]]" performed by the Vince Guaraldi Trio *[[Grammy Awards of 1962]] **[[Galt MacDermot]] for "African Waltz" performed by [[Julian Cannonball Adderley|Cannonball Adderley]] *[[Grammy Awards of 1961]] **[[Gil Evans]] & [[Miles Davis]] for ''[[Sketches of Spain]]'' {{DEFAULTSORT:Grammy Award For Best Original Jazz Composition}} [[Category:Grammy Awards for jazz]] [[Category:Awards established in 1961]] [[Category:Awards established in 1967]]
